sentence.Network_en: There were over 40 tenants, all occupying one wing of the hospital.
sentence.Network_cn: 共有40多位房客，他们全部住在这家医院的一个病区。

sentence.Network_en: The occupying forces set up a puppet government .
sentence.Network_cn: 占领军建立了一个傀儡政府。

sentence.Network_en: It was an explosion of anger against the practices of the occupying forces.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是人们不满占领军行为而爆发的怒火。

entry.tran: 居住，使用（建筑物或某地）
entry.def: The people who occupy a building or a place are the people who live or work there.

example.ex: There were over 40 tenants, all occupying one wing of the hospital...
example.tran: 共有40多位房客，他们全部住在这家医院的一个病区。

example.ex: Land is, in most instances, purchased by those who occupy it.
example.tran: 在大多数情况下，土地都是由其使用者购得。

entry.def: If a room or something such as a seat is occupied, someone is using it, so that it is not available for anyone else.

example.ex: The hospital bed is no longer occupied by his wife...
example.tran: 他的妻子不在这张病床上了。

example.ex: I saw three camp beds, two of which were occupied.
example.tran: 我看见了3张折叠床，其中两张已有人占了。

entry.def: If a group of people or an army occupies a place or country, they move into it, using force in order to gain control of it.

example.ex: U.S. forces now occupy a part of the country...
example.tran: 美国军队现在占领了该国的一部分。

example.ex: Alexandretta had been occupied by the French in 1918 after the defeat of Turkey.
example.tran: 土耳其溃败之后，亚历山大勒塔在1918年被法国人占领。

entry.def: If someone or something occupies a particular place in a system, process, or plan, they have that place.

example.ex: We occupy a quality position in the market place...
example.tran: 我们在市场上居于高端地位。

example.ex: Men still occupy more positions of power than women.
example.tran: 担任要职的男性仍然比女性多。

entry.def: If something occupies you, or if you occupy yourself, your time, or your mind with it, you are busy doing that thing or thinking about it.

example.ex: Her parliamentary career has occupied all of her time...
example.tran: 她整日忙于议会的工作。

example.ex: He hurried to take the suitcases and occupy himself with packing the car...
example.tran: 他急匆匆地去拎手提箱，忙着往车里装。

entry.tran: 使从事；使关注；使花费时间
entry.def: If something occupies you, it requires your efforts, attention, or time.

example.ex: I had other matters to occupy me, during the day at least...
example.tran: 至少白天我还有别的事情要做。

example.ex: This challenge will occupy Europe for a generation or more.
example.tran: 这将是欧洲在未来二三十年或者更长的时间里所要面临的挑战。

entry.def: If something occupies a particular area or place, it fills or covers it, or exists there.

example.ex: Even quite small aircraft occupy a lot of space...
example.tran: 哪怕很小的飞机也要占很大的空间。

example.ex: Bookshelves occupied most of the living room walls.
example.tran: 这些书架占了起居室的大部分墙面。

entry.def: If something such as a journey occupies a particular period of time, it takes that amount of time to complete.

example.ex: She reached Karachi on Monday evening, the journey having occupied three days and nine hours.
example.tran: 她在星期一晚上抵达了卡拉奇，这段行程耗时3天9小时。

auth_sentence.content: That is the usual fate of an occupying force.
auth_sentence.res_content: That is the usual fate of an occupying force.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That is the usual fate of an occupying force.

auth_sentence.content: Space is matter occupying time defined by thy interference.
auth_sentence.res_content: Space is matter occupying time defined by thy interference.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Space is matter occupying time defined by thy interference.

auth_sentence.content: It sounds like a conquering army occupying a defeated city.
auth_sentence.res_content: It sounds like a conquering army occupying a defeated city.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It sounds like a conquering army occupying a defeated city.
